main event: An unidentified bright blue-white light was observed traveling rapidly from the southeast to the northeast in Lawrenceburg, Indiana on October 4, 1967.
interesting points: The object was traveling at high speed and disappeared like a star-shell.
The observer indicated the object was traveling as fast as a jet.
The observer noted the object 'just disappeared, as if watching it go away or something on the horizon, then disappear.'
The observer had seen 5 or 6 similar objects previously and had reported them.
A sketch was provided showing the path and motion of the object.
